body_html:
BTW, I don't see post-partitioning GraphDefs in RunMetadata when running with tf.RunOptions.FULL_TRACE, is there some extra option to turn that on?

RunOptions.output_partition_graphs

It's a separate flag because the GraphDefs are typically large and you don't want to collect them every time.
body_text:
BTW, I don't see post-partitioning GraphDefs in RunMetadata when running with tf.RunOptions.FULL_TRACE, is there some extra option to turn that on?

RunOptions.output_partition_graphs
It's a separate flag because the GraphDefs are typically large and you don't want to collect them every time.
body:
>  BTW, I don't see post-partitioning GraphDefs in RunMetadata when running with tf.RunOptions.FULL_TRACE, is there some extra option to turn that on?

`RunOptions.output_partition_graphs`

It's a separate flag because the GraphDefs are typically large and you don't want to collect them every time.
